page.title: 03EAST WITTERING VILLAGE
page.content: East Wittering is a coastal village situated on the South coast of England.It is seven miles South of the city of Chichester,which is the county town of West Sussex.East Wittering is set on a flat,low plain surrounded on all sides by agricultural land,except by sea to the South.This flat plain stretches eight miles inland,where the South Downs begin.Their presence can have a marked effect upon local weather patterns.For instance,the movement of seasonal thunder storms further inland can be temporarily halted by this range of hills. Before the motor car was invented only 180 people lived in the village but today there are about 2,000 inhabitants.During the summer months with the arrival of the holiday makers this increases to approximately 8,000 people.
